snippet: Leung Chun-ying, the chief executive, said any talks with protest leaders would be within the parameters of Beijing’s blueprint for political change in Hong Kong.
abstract: Hong Kong's embattled chief executive Leung Chun-ying rejects demands that he resign and assigns his deputy to meet with student protesters to discuss their calls for democratic reform; says any talks will be within the parameters of Beijing’s blueprint for political change in Hong Kong.

byline.original: By AUSTIN RAMZY and KEITH BRADSHER
byline.contributor: Chris Buckley and Alan Wong contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Leung Chun-ying, the chief executive, said any talks with protest leaders would be within the parameters of Beijing’s blueprint for political change in Hong Kong.

headline.main: Hong Kong Leader Refuses to Resign, but Deputy to Meet With Protesters
headline.print_headline: Hong Kong Leader Refuses to Resign, but Deputy Meets With Protesters
